description: Rear dormer; installation of two rooflights in front roofslope and new window in gable end
decision_conditions: <p><span style="color: rgb(85, 85, 85); font-family: sans-serif;">The proposed development plans submitted are not an accurate depiction of the existing property nor reflective of the site appearance. The plans fail to show the development property as having a lower ridgeline to the two storey side extension previously approved height and the existing depth and scale of the previously approved single storey rear extension. As such,&nbsp; the&nbsp;</span><span style="color: rgb(21, 5, 39); font-family: elza, sans-serif;">detailed design and deviations are contrary to the NPPF (2023) and Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development management policies (2013).&nbsp;</span><br></p>

<p><span style="line-height: 115%;">The proposed rear roof dormer, by reason of their
excessive cumulative scale and massing, poor positioning, and presence along both
Weston Drive and York Avenue, would result in an overly dominant, top heavy,
bulky and visually obtrusive form of development, at odds with the prevailing visual
character of both the host property and wider area, contrary to the high
quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023),
Policy D3.D1 and D11 of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow
Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies
Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential
Design Guide (2010).</span><br></p>
